page.title: 14Pubs Beetham
page.content: The Kings Arms is about three hundred years old.It was originally built as a farmhouse.It was used as a coaching inn at one time.The mounting block which was situated by the stables has been moved to the front. It can accommodate six guests.It has a good reputation for bar snacks of which their own cooked ham is the favourite dish and beer the most popular drink. The Wheatsheaf Hotel is in the centre of Beetham Village.It is quite old,but the mock Elizabethan decoration was added in the nineteenth century.It can accommodate about twelve people.It has a restaurant upstairs.There are still iron rings outside for tying up horses.The present car park was once the village pond.
